intro: Scabiosa lucida f. alpicola, commonly known as the alpine scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to the harsh conditions of high-altitude habitats. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in mountain ecosystems.
